html.question: What is HTML?
html.answer: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It is the standard markup language for creating web pages.

html.question: What is the purpose of the <title> tag?
html.answer: The <title> tag sets the title of the webpage, shown in the browser tab or title bar.

html.question: How do you create a hyperlink in HTML?
html.answer: Use the tag with the href attribute. Example: Click here.

html.question: What is an HTML attribute?
html.answer: Attributes provide additional information about an element, like id or class, written inside the opening tag.

html.question: How do you insert an image in HTML?
html.answer: Use the tag with the src attribute. Example: .

html.question: What is the difference between <div> and <span>?
html.answer: <div> is a block-level container, while <span> is an inline container.

html.question: How do you create a list in HTML?
html.answer: Use <ul> for unordered (bulleted) lists or <ol> for ordered (numbered) lists, with <li> for items.

html.question: What is semantic HTML?
html.answer: Semantic HTML uses tags like <header>, <footer>, and <article> to give meaning to content.

html.question: How do you add a comment in HTML?
html.answer: Use <!-- and -->. Example: <!-- This is a comment -->.

html.question: What is the purpose of the alt attribute?
html.answer: The alt attribute provides alternative text for images if they fail to load or for accessibility.

html.question: How do you create a table in HTML?
html.answer: Use <table>, <tr> for rows, <th> for headers, and <td> for data cells.

html.question: What is the <body> tag used for?
html.answer: The <body> tag contains the visible content of a webpage, like text, images, and links.

html.question: How do you link a CSS file to HTML?
html.answer: Use the <link> tag in the <head>. Example: <link rel='stylesheet' href='styles.css'>.

html.question: What is the <meta> tag used for?
html.answer: The <meta> tag provides metadata about the HTML document, like charset or viewport settings.

html.question: How do you create a form in HTML?
html.answer: Use the <form> tag with input elements like <input> or <textarea>. Example: <form action='/submit'><input type='text'></form>.

html.question: What is the purpose of the <head> tag?
html.answer: The <head> tag contains metadata, links to stylesheets, and scripts that are not directly visible.

html.question: What is the role of the DOCTYPE declaration?
html.answer: The <!DOCTYPE html> declaration at the start of an HTML file specifies the document type and version.

html.question: How do you create a button in HTML?
html.answer: Use the <button> tag. Example: <button>Click me</button>.

html.question: What is the <section> tag used for?
html.answer: The <section> tag groups related content, often with a heading, for semantic structure.

html.question: How do you embed a video in HTML?
html.answer: Use the <video> tag with the src attribute. Example: <video src='video.mp4' controls></video>.

html.question: What is the difference between inline and block elements?
html.answer: Block elements (e.g., <div>) take full width and start on a new line; inline elements (e.g., <span>) flow within text.

html.question: How do you create a dropdown menu in HTML?
html.answer: Use the <select> tag with <option> tags. Example: <select><option>Item 1</option><option>Item 2</option></select>.

html.question: What is the purpose of the id attribute?
html.answer: The id attribute provides a unique identifier for an element, used for CSS or JavaScript targeting.

html.question: How do you add a favicon to a webpage?
html.answer: Use the <link> tag with rel='icon'. Example: <link rel='icon' href='favicon.ico'>.

html.question: What is the <article> tag used for?
html.answer: The <article> tag represents independent, self-contained content, like a blog post.

html.question: How do you create a horizontal rule in HTML?
html.answer: Use the <hr> tag to add a thematic break or horizontal line.

html.question: What is the purpose of the class attribute?
html.answer: The class attribute groups elements for styling or scripting, allowing multiple elements to share the same class.

html.question: How do you embed audio in HTML?
html.answer: Use the <audio> tag with the src attribute. Example: <audio src='sound.mp3' controls></audio>.

html.question: What is the <nav> tag used for?
html.answer: The <nav> tag defines a block of navigation links, like a menu.

html.question: How do you create a checkbox in HTML?
html.answer: Use the <input> tag with type='checkbox'. Example: <input type='checkbox' name='option'>.

html.question: What is the purpose of the lang attribute?
html.answer: The lang attribute specifies the language of an element’s content, like lang='en' for English.

html.question: How do you set the character encoding in HTML?
html.answer: Use the <meta> tag with charset. Example: <meta charset='UTF-8'>.

css.question: What is CSS?
css.answer: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets. It styles the appearance of HTML content.

css.question: How do you change the text color in CSS?
css.answer: Use the color property. Example: color: blue;.

css.question: What is a class selector?
css.answer: A class selector targets elements with a specific class using a dot. Example: .myClass { }.

css.question: How do you select an element by ID in CSS?
css.answer: Use the # symbol followed by the ID. Example: #myId { }.

css.question: What is the difference between margin and padding?
css.answer: Margin is the space outside an element; padding is the space inside, between content and border.

css.question: How do you center an element horizontally?
css.answer: Use margin: 0 auto; with a set width on a block element.

css.question: What is the CSS box model?
css.answer: The box model includes content, padding, border, and margin around an element.

css.question: How do you set a background color?
css.answer: Use the background-color property. Example: background-color: green;.

css.question: What are media queries?
css.answer: Media queries apply styles based on conditions like screen size. Example: @media (max-width: 600px) { }.

css.question: How do you make text bold in CSS?
css.answer: Use font-weight: bold; or font-weight: 700;.

css.question: What is flexbox?
css.answer: Flexbox is a CSS layout model for arranging items in a container flexibly.

css.question: How do you hide an element in CSS?
css.answer: Use display: none; to remove it or visibility: hidden; to hide without removing space.

css.question: What is a pseudo-class?
css.answer: A pseudo-class styles elements in specific states, like :hover or :active.

css.question: How do you change font size in CSS?
css.answer: Use the font-size property. Example: font-size: 16px;.

css.question: What is the purpose of z-index?
css.answer: z-index controls the stacking order of overlapping elements; higher values are in front.

css.question: How do you set a background image in CSS?
css.answer: Use the background-image property. Example: background-image: url('image.jpg');.

css.question: What is the difference between relative and absolute positioning?
css.answer: Relative positioning moves an element relative to its normal position; absolute moves it relative to its nearest positioned ancestor.

css.question: How do you create a CSS grid?
css.answer: Use display: grid; and define columns/rows with grid-template-columns and grid-template-rows.

css.question: How do you apply styles to a specific HTML element type?
css.answer: Use the element name as the selector. Example: p { color: black; }.

css.question: What is the box-sizing property?
css.answer: box-sizing defines how width and height are calculated. Example: box-sizing: border-box; includes padding and border.

css.question: How do you create a hover effect in CSS?
css.answer: Use the :hover pseudo-class. Example: button:hover { background-color: blue; }.

css.question: What is the purpose of the float property?
css.answer: Float positions an element to the left or right, allowing content to wrap around it.

css.question: How do you set font family in CSS?
css.answer: Use the font-family property. Example: font-family: Arial, sans-serif;.

css.question: What is a CSS reset?
css.answer: A CSS reset removes default browser styling to ensure consistency across browsers.

css.question: How do you make an element transparent in CSS?
css.answer: Use the opacity property. Example: opacity: 0.5;.

css.question: What is the display property in CSS?
css.answer: The display property controls layout behavior, like block, inline, or flex.

css.question: How do you create a rounded corner in CSS?
css.answer: Use the border-radius property. Example: border-radius: 10px;.

css.question: What is the purpose of the overflow property?
css.answer: Overflow controls how content is handled if it exceeds an element’s size, like hidden or scroll.

css.question: How do you vertically center an element with flexbox?
css.answer: Use display: flex; and align-items: center; on the parent container.

css.question: What is a CSS variable?
css.answer: A CSS variable stores reusable values. Example: :root { --main-color: blue; } and use with var(--main-color).

css.question: How do you apply multiple classes to an element?
css.answer: List classes in the class attribute, separated by spaces. Example: <div class='class1 class2'>.

css.question: What is the purpose of the transition property?
css.answer: Transition creates smooth changes for properties like color. Example: transition: color 0.3s;.

css.question: How do you style the first child of an element?
css.answer: Use the :first-child pseudo-class. Example: li:first-child { color: red; }.

css.question: What is the difference between inline-block and block?
css.answer: Inline-block allows elements to sit inline but respect width/height; block takes full width and starts on a new line.

css.question: How do you create a shadow effect in CSS?
css.answer: Use the box-shadow property. Example: box-shadow: 2px 2px 5px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);.

javascript.question: What is JavaScript?
javascript.answer: JavaScript is a programming language that adds interactivity to web pages.

javascript.question: How do you declare a variable in JavaScript?
javascript.answer: Use var, let, or const. Example: let name = 'John';.

javascript.question: How do you write a comment in JavaScript?
javascript.answer: Use // for single-line or /* */ for multi-line comments.

javascript.question: What is a function in JavaScript?
javascript.answer: A function is a reusable block of code. Example: function sayHi() { alert('Hi'); }.

javascript.question: What is the difference between let and var?
javascript.answer: let has block scope, while var has function scope; let prevents redeclaration.

javascript.question: How do you create an array in JavaScript?
javascript.answer: Use square brackets. Example: let colors = ['red', 'blue'];.

javascript.question: What is the DOM?
javascript.answer: The Document Object Model (DOM) is a representation of HTML elements as objects in JavaScript.

javascript.question: How do you select an element by ID in JavaScript?
javascript.answer: Use document.getElementById('idName');.

javascript.question: What is an event in JavaScript?
javascript.answer: An event is an action (like a click) that JavaScript can respond to.

javascript.question: How do you loop through an array?
javascript.answer: Use a for loop or forEach. Example: array.forEach(item => console.log(item));.

javascript.question: What is a string in JavaScript?
javascript.answer: A string is a sequence of characters, like 'hello', enclosed in quotes.

javascript.question: How do you handle errors in JavaScript?
javascript.answer: Use try-catch blocks. Example: try { /* code */ } catch (error) { console.log(error); }.

javascript.question: What is the difference between == and ===?
javascript.answer: == compares value after type coercion; === compares value and type strictly.

javascript.question: How do you add an element to the DOM?
javascript.answer: Use methods like appendChild() or innerHTML after creating it with createElement().

javascript.question: What are template literals?
javascript.answer: Template literals use backticks for strings with embedded expressions. Example: `Hello, ${name}`.

javascript.question: What is a JavaScript object?
javascript.answer: An object is a collection of key-value pairs. Example: let person = { name: 'John', age: 30 };.

javascript.question: How do you add an event listener in JavaScript?
javascript.answer: Use addEventListener. Example: element.addEventListener('click', () => alert('Clicked'));.

javascript.question: What is the purpose of the console.log() method?
javascript.answer: console.log() outputs data to the browser’s console for debugging.

javascript.question: How do you merge two arrays in JavaScript?
javascript.answer: Use the spread operator or concat(). Example: let newArray = [...array1, ...array2];.

javascript.question: What is a callback function?
javascript.answer: A callback is a function passed as an argument to another function to be executed later.

javascript.question: How do you check if a variable is undefined?
javascript.answer: Use typeof or compare with undefined. Example: if (typeof variable === 'undefined') { }.

javascript.question: What is the purpose of the setTimeout function?
javascript.answer: setTimeout delays code execution. Example: setTimeout(() => console.log('Delayed'), 1000);.

javascript.question: How do you convert a string to a number?
javascript.answer: Use parseInt() for integers or parseFloat() for decimals. Example: parseInt('123');.

javascript.question: What is a JavaScript closure?
javascript.answer: A closure is a function that retains access to its outer scope’s variables even after the outer function finishes.

javascript.question: How do you select multiple elements in JavaScript?
javascript.answer: Use document.querySelectorAll(). Example: document.querySelectorAll('.className');.

javascript.question: What is the difference between null and undefined?
javascript.answer: null is an assigned value meaning 'no value'; undefined means a variable is declared but not assigned.

javascript.question: How do you create a conditional statement?
javascript.answer: Use if, else if, and else. Example: if (x > 0) { console.log('Positive'); } else { console.log('Not positive'); }.

javascript.question: What is the purpose of the JSON.parse() method?
javascript.answer: JSON.parse() converts a JSON string into a JavaScript object.

javascript.question: How do you remove an element from an array?
javascript.answer: Use methods like splice() or filter(). Example: array.splice(index, 1);.

javascript.question: What is the arrow function syntax?
javascript.answer: Arrow functions use =>. Example: const add = (a, b) => a + b;.

javascript.question: How do you get the length of an array?
javascript.answer: Use the length property. Example: array.length;.

javascript.question: What is the purpose of the this keyword?
javascript.answer: this refers to the object that owns the executing code, often the calling object.

javascript.question: How do you check if an element exists in an array?
javascript.answer: Use includes() or indexOf(). Example: array.includes('value');.

javascript.question: What is the purpose of the return statement?
javascript.answer: return specifies the value a function outputs and stops its execution.

javascript.question: How do you change an element’s text content?
javascript.answer: Use textContent or innerText. Example: element.textContent = 'New text';.
